body:
@Nika-St You can view more than 3 parameters in the latest version of MLflow.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17039389/169263159-78cb6487-1586-47f0-8913-7cce401d926a.mov
Thanks for your response @harupy ! This is nice but one needs to scroll through all the params/samlpes this way. I was meaning the ones "pinned", which you can see all at once.

Hi @Jingnan-Jia , sure, it's great - but could be much better :)
I'm surely not suggesting to squeeze all available metrics and params in there, but there's enough space so select up to 6 of both of them to be displayed permanently:
![2022-05-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29167311/169300828-cbc0b8ed-9291-4901-b14b-78779b5804c5.png)

And when you expand either params or metrics, you see all the params which have ever been logged in that experiment and which are possibly not even needed anymore but everything else is hidden:
![2022-05-19 (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29167311/169301306-f51567eb-0461-4e57-ad1a-464b4eb49175.png)

When looking at the list of runs, one usually looks at several params and several metrics together.
I think I realized your question now. But I have no clear idea how to improve it.
If I knew anything about web development, I would've suggested an idea. So it's much more involved than increasing the number of columns?
@Nika-St Can you select the columns you want to see using the column selector?
@Nika-St Can we close this issue or the column selector doesn't fulfill your use case?

@harupy , it doesn't, unfortunately: I can select params and metrics, but only up to 3 of them can be shown permanently. If I click the arrow button next to Params or Metrics in the table header, all of them show up, hiding everything else to the right (as in the second screenshot [here](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/5895#issuecomment-1131673045)), so looking at more than 3 relevant params and metrics at once becomes impossible
